snippet.textDisplay: Hey Mike, thank you so much for the incredible information. I run a local morning radio show and Covid-19 has dominated our discussion for the last few weeks. The amount of misinformation going about over this is staggering and it’s so hard to keep the community informed on how to stay safe while also having to pick apart what’s right and what’s wrong. Just wanted to say thanks again for all you do! Stay safe and healthy (or as you always say, happy and healthy bee woop)!
snippet.textOriginal: Hey Mike, thank you so much for the incredible information. I run a local morning radio show and Covid-19 has dominated our discussion for the last few weeks. The amount of misinformation going about over this is staggering and it’s so hard to keep the community informed on how to stay safe while also having to pick apart what’s right and what’s wrong. Just wanted to say thanks again for all you do! Stay safe and healthy (or as you always say, happy and healthy bee woop)!

snippet.textDisplay:
3:43 N95 masks are "dust" masks, not biohazard masks, that prevent 95% of particles (not vapors, not airborne droplets) > 0.3 micron; COVID-19 ~125 nm, reportedly, "the smallest particles are 0.06 microns, and the largest are 0.14 microns."
any face mask helps in 2 ways: probable deflection of the airborne droplets, prevent mindless face-mouth-nose-touching
snippet.textOriginal:

snippet.textDisplay: I heard most people are going to just be sent home if they have the virus. You're also mentioning we aren't even testing people as we should. Is it even worth it to go to the hospital then? Is it possible to just self treat this or is it completely irresponsible? (If it's a mild case on a healthy person OBVIOUSLY). I'm asking cause I also saw a post going around telling people to stock up on medicines like Tylenol, Advil, and Mucinex (it was supposedly advise from a nurse). So that might be something you want to address as legit or fake, specially since people often avoid healthcare because of the cost.

snippet.textDisplay:
I’m quite curious why don’t u guys wear a surgical mask. I’m from Hong Kong and almost all of us wear one when we are outdoor and wash our hands immediately when we’re back home. Now we have fewer cases every day and most of them are from people who recently travel. As those who are infected may not have any symptoms for a few days. Won’t wearing surgical masks prevent us from inhaling respiratory droplets from these “invincible” patients? Will wearing surgical masks flatten the curve and alleviate the spread?

*sorry for terrible grammar

snippet.textDisplay:
I’m just frustrated at the fact that the CDC refused to buy existing COVID-19 testing kits from South Korea and instead insisted on making their own. They were flawed and they had to remake them. No one — hospitals, health departments, states have enough testing kits. We should be testing tens of thousands of Americans per day!

Is it because America doesn’t like the idea of “being dependent” on another country so we’re going use up precious time by designing and producing our own testing kits? That just delays everything and makes matters worse. Just buy the one that ALREADY WORKS. At least let the FDA look into it to see for themselves.
- https://m.dailykos.com/stories/2020/3/12/1926801/-FDA-Has-Not-Approved-South-Korea-COVID-19-Testing-Kit-Fast-Automated-Multiple-Testing-Genes-People

Update: The FDA did recently approve an emergency test for COVID-19 (by a Swiss pharmaceutical giant Roche’s automated testing machine). Although the company is increasing their speed of production by a factor of 10, Roche said “it was going to the limits of its capacity to produce more testing kits.”
- https://www.forbes.com/sites/isabeltogoh/2020/03/13/fda-approves-emergency-new-coronavirus-test-to-boost-screening-in-the-us/
snippet.textOriginal:
I’m just frustrated at the fact that the CDC refused to buy existing COVID-19 testing kits from South Korea and instead insisted on making their own. They were flawed and they had to remake them. No one — hospitals, health departments, states have enough testing kits. We should be testing tens of thousands of Americans per day!

Is it because America doesn’t like the idea of “being dependent” on another country so we’re going use up precious time by designing and producing our own testing kits? That just delays everything and makes matters worse. Just buy the one that ALREADY WORKS. At least let the FDA look into it to see for themselves. 
- https://m.dailykos.com/stories/2020/3/12/1926801/-FDA-Has-Not-Approved-South-Korea-COVID-19-Testing-Kit-Fast-Automated-Multiple-Testing-Genes-People

snippet.textDisplay: Employers need to be more understanding about employees staying home when they have symptoms. I work at a hospital and even though I'm not direct care staff I supervise the nutrition department and handle patients food. I called in sick as a precaution and got the third degree from my supervisor for following our quarantine protocol. It's like they are only telling us to stay home as a formality to cover their own asses but in reality they want us to lie and come in anyway. Which leads to another problem. All these businesses are closing so staff won't be punished for staying home but you can't just close a hospital during a pandemic(or ever for that matter) and if everyone is sick then there's nobody to staff the hospital. So even though we are doing the right thing, they are still enforcing attendance policy. It's a mess.
snippet.textOriginal: Employers need to be more understanding about employees staying home when they have symptoms. I work at a hospital and even though I'm not direct care staff I supervise the nutrition department and handle patients food. I called in sick as a precaution and got the third degree from my supervisor for following our quarantine protocol. It's like they are only telling us to stay home as a formality to cover their own asses but in reality they want us to lie and come in anyway. Which leads to another problem. All these businesses are closing so staff won't be punished for staying home but you can't just close a hospital during a pandemic(or ever for that matter) and if everyone is sick then there's nobody to staff the hospital. So even though we are doing the right thing, they are still enforcing attendance policy. It's a mess.

snippet.textDisplay: Got holidays for Covid-19 in med school in Telangana, India. snippet.textDisplay:
It’s amusing, we have two major parties at play here.

One, which my father is part of, is like, “Everyone is overreacting! Bring back sporting events! Bring back concerts!”
The other is like, “OMG WE’RE ALL GONNA’ DIE! THIS IS THE END! EVERY MAN FOR THEMSELVES!”

Then there’s people like me, “I’m not taking either side. All of you are equally as irrational. What needs to happen is we need to be cautious, but not paranoid. We need to learn what this thing is and what are it’s possible next moves, and act accordingly before we bring back public events. Limit your time in public in a reasonable, rational way.”
snippet.textOriginal:
It’s amusing, we have two major parties at play here.

One, which my father is part of, is like, “Everyone is overreacting! Bring back sporting events! Bring back concerts!”
The other is like, “OMG WE’RE ALL GONNA’ DIE! THIS IS THE END! EVERY MAN FOR THEMSELVES!”

Then there’s people like me, “I’m not taking either side. All of you are equally as irrational. What needs to happen is we need to be cautious, but not paranoid. We need to learn what this thing is and what are it’s possible next moves, and act accordingly before we bring back public events. Limit your time in public in a reasonable, rational way.”

snippet.textDisplay:
Politically and economically motivated

Source: FC
University of Hamburg data

The number of deaths in the world in the first two months of 2020

2,360 : Corona virus
69,602 : Common cold
  140,584 : Malaria
  153,696 : suicide
  193,479 : road accident
240,950 : HIV loss
 358,471 : alcohol
  716,498 : smoking
 1,177,141 : Cancer

Then do you think Corona is dangerous? Or is the purpose of the media campaign to settle the trade war between China and America or to reduce financial markets to prepare the stage of financial markets for mergers and acquisitions or to sell US Treasury bonds to cover the fiscal deficit in them !!

Do you know that almost 25,000 people die from starvation everyday i.e. 9,000,000 (Nine Million) a year and there is no mention in media.

snippet.textDisplay:
Today 3.16.2020 here in austria plenty restricions are getting put

no restaurants.. no bars no cafes no shops other than supermarkets and pharmacies
if you leave your home you have to explain why and whar for to the police... if you are getting caught gathering together in or outdoors you will get fines up to ~4000$ (3600€)
borders are closed for anyone who doesnt deliver food medication and such very important goods


i am sick now... staying home.. called the local hotline.. got told its unlikely that i got covid but should quarantine myself at home (which i do) and wait if my symptoms getting worse.. if yes i shall call again and i will get tested (im 28)
if i recover in the next few days than thats fine

Hey Dr.Mike, I have a dog that lives outside in my garden and he hasn’t seen people (except us) in multiple weeks since my parents don’t want me to go outside because of the c o r o n a which is fine but now they don’t want me to interact with him at all because they say “someone next door might have it and they may have spread it through the fence and that even if my dog doesn’t have the.
c o r o n a he might have in his fur.” I think this is ridiculous since the chances of someone being infected is in the house next door, going out in the garden and sneeze or cough for those particles to pass through tiny gaps in the fence and landing on my dog have to be tiny. idk what to do so i would really appreciate it if you can convince them somehow as you are a doctor they will probably believe you.

snippet.textDisplay:
Hi Doctor Mike, I have a question: Are homemade masks made out of cloth, or paper towels somehow effective against contacting droplets of corona virus?
I just read about the fact that viruses are as small as 0.1microns, and they are subjected to brownian motion, and there is a bigger change to be filtered by any sort of material, rather than not wearing a mask. Obviously, I'm only asking about wearing a mask when going out in a place that is populated by possibly infected people.
Thank you very much, and keep up the good work!
snippet.textOriginal:
Hi Doctor Mike, I have a question: Are homemade masks made out of cloth, or paper towels somehow effective against contacting droplets of corona virus? 
I just read about the fact that viruses are as small as 0.1microns, and they are subjected to brownian motion, and there is a bigger change to be filtered by any sort of material, rather than not wearing a mask. Obviously, I'm only asking about wearing a mask when going out in a place that is populated by possibly infected people.
Thank you very much, and keep up the good work!

snippet.textDisplay:
Thank you, Doc, for all of the work that you're doing on the front lines right now. I'm sure that this is a frantic moment in your career. Not only are you all scrambling to find medical advancements to best care for your patients, but you're also protecting your own health, possibly running low on medical equipment and fearing the possibility of running out of beds. I'm sure there are other concerns that the general public is not aware of.


In the midst of it all, you've somehow managed to consistently update and educate us on what's going on and how we can play our part to best protect ourselves, our loved ones, and the rest of the world. This is not only a display of your work ethic but also your passion for keeping us all healthy and safe.


You're doing a great job, and I wish you the best of luck and blessings during this time.


Stay safe and healthy.

Stay safe and healthy.

My entire freaking town is flipping out. The stores are empty of food, tp, and other essentials do to the panic, schools are shut down, and everything is cancelled. Tomorrow, since the store is out of everything, I'm going to be trading a cake for jars of homemade butter and some tea.

snippet.textDisplay:
My grandmother is already saying, "The bible already said this would happen! There will be pandemics! This is the end of the world and Jesus is coming back!" As if there haven't been pandemics all throughout human history. As if this one is somehow worse than any other pandemic in the history of disease. Someone please save me; she's turning this pandemic into a religious tangent.


Oh, and she's been saying, "It's better to panic and overreact than under-react!"

snippet.textDisplay: We don't have a lot of cases but every school in my province (Quebec) is closed for at least 2 weeks and it's no events with more than 250 people. A lot of offices are letting their employees work from home when it's possible. And yesterday our provincial gouvernment asked for all the libraries, polls, buffets, cinemas, etc. to be closed.

snippet.textDisplay: At this point I'm still not super concerned for it. It's a new virus, that's also an old virus apparently, that is infecting people. It'll cause damage, it'll kill people, and then it'll move on and we'll group this scare in with the 2012/Y2K/Rapture/Meteor scares. However I do feel the response the world has given on a global scale has been completely unreasonable and alarming. Should hard hit areas like Italy, China, South Korea, Washington State/NYC/California be concerned and take measures to prevent it? Absolutely. But when they start causing mass panic in low impacted areas, shutting down stores, sending folks home who are healthy, and essentially leaving millions of able-bodied folks with nothing to do and no income, it creates new problems I don't see anyone even remotely going to try and help with. Everyone is so concerned about the well-being of the 80+ year old seniors who are at the most risk of dying to it, but when it's over nobody will bat an eye at the 20 to 40 year old people who are now in their own financial crisis. People were already struggling before this and now we're expected to just stay home and also put food on our tables? The United States will be mass eating Ramen Noodles and nobody will care that sodium levels will be through the roof for younger folks. Funny enough my coworkers have already joked that since 1/3 of them are living paycheck to paycheck, if their store closes they're going to form a gang and rob the seniors in the richer cul-de-sacs in the area. And you know what? Good for them for having a financial fallback plan.

However I do feel the response the world has given on a global scale has been completely unreasonable and alarming. Should hard hit areas like Italy, China, South Korea, Washington State/NYC/California be concerned and take measures to prevent it? Absolutely. But when they start causing mass panic in low impacted areas, shutting down stores, sending folks home who are healthy, and essentially leaving millions of able-bodied folks with nothing to do and no income, it creates new problems I don't see anyone even remotely going to try and help with. Everyone is so concerned about the well-being of the 80+ year old seniors who are at the most risk of dying to it, but when it's over nobody will bat an eye at the 20 to 40 year old people who are now in their own financial crisis. People were already struggling before this and now we're expected to just stay home and also put food on our tables? The United States will be mass eating Ramen Noodles and nobody will care that sodium levels will be through the roof for younger folks. Funny enough my coworkers have already joked that since 1/3 of them are living paycheck to paycheck, if their store closes they're going to form a gang and rob the seniors in the richer cul-de-sacs in the area. And you know what? Good for them for having a financial fallback plan.

snippet.textDisplay: This message should have maybe been made WEEKS AGO. This virus IS NOT a surprise, it's been around since DECEMBER. WHY did NO ONE take this seriously sooner?!! The signs were all there - I was ridiculed and trolled for trying to raise awareness and now look 🤦‍♀️🤦‍♀️🤦‍♀️ I actually can't get over this, the only reason I can think as to why was because the governments WANT CV to spread to cull populations. This has been known FOR MONTHS and NOTHING was done, and still now not enough is being done!! What the hell?! 🤦‍♀️🤦‍♀️🤦‍♀️ Still people now don't see it as a big problem. I'm actually dead.
